moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 g6 3. e4 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: I wanted to try a different approach.
moves.10... Bxc3 11. dxc3: Black has doubled whites pawns, but has lost a strong bishop.
moves.11... e5 12. fxe5 h6 13. Nh3: ? Nxe4 was better, after which White has reasonable compensation.
moves.13... Na6 14. O-O Qe7: Black seems to be developing nicely.
moves.17. Be3 Rhf8 18. Nf2: White does not want to exchange rooks yet.
moves.20. b4: ! White needs to drive the N off from defending the e pawn, after which a strong attack will ensue.
moves.20... Ne6 21. Nxe4: Here White can afford to exchange rooks.
moves.21... Rxf1+ 22. Rxf1 Qe7: Black wants to save the N from capture.
moves.23. Rf6: But this pin is very strong.
moves.23... Kd7: After this move, White gets more than just the piece back.
